intro: Paronychia fastigiata, commonly known as the upright paronychia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Paronychia fastigiata is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its compact form and attractive blooms.
